org.opendaylight.controller.arphandler.internal

Class ArpHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.arphandler.internal.ArpHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICacheUpdateAware<ARPEvent,java.lang.Boolean>, IHostFinder, IListenDataPacket

    public class ArpHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements IHostFinder, IListenDataPacket, ICacheUpdateAware<ARPEvent,java.lang.Boolean>
    The ArpHandler offers services to react on ARP requests and replies sent by network hosts. Moreover it allows for creating ARP messages by the controller itself. The ARP Handler on ODL doesn't use the requester MAC address in order to avoid to have to build a spanning tree where to forward ARP Requests. The ARP requests are broadcast packets so in order to reach everywhere need to be flooded, when you flood in a network that is not a tree (all the networks has some level of redundancy) that would create forwarding loops without a spanning tree. Given the need is only to send out the ARP requests toward all the hosts we actually don't need to implement a flooding mechanism in software (which would be expensive) we just send out the ARP request toward all the ports that are suspected to be host ports on all the switches (from the controller). Now the condition for which a port is marked as host port could potentially be incorrect so when the controller sends out the ARP Request that could come back to the controller and could cause another request not needed. So changing the source MAC address of the request to be the one of the controller, controller can protect itself from honoring twice the same request. This enables an ARP handler resolution, without the need of spanning tree and limiting software flooding to the minimum required.

      • find

        public void find(java.net.InetAddress networkAddress)
        Description copied from interface: IHostFinder
        This method initiates the discovery of a host based on its IP address. This is triggered by query of an application to the HostTracker. The requested IP address doesn't exist in the local database at this point.
        Specified by:
        find in interface IHostFinder
        Parameters:
        networkAddress - IP Address encapsulated in InetAddress class

      • probe

        public void probe(HostNodeConnector host)
        Description copied from interface: IHostFinder
        This method is called by HostTracker to see if a learned Host is still in the network. Used mostly for ARP Aging.
        Specified by:
        probe in interface IHostFinder
        Parameters:
        host - The Host that needs to be probed

      • receiveDataPacket

        public PacketResult receiveDataPacket(RawPacket inPkt)
        Description copied from interface: IListenDataPacket
        Handler for receiving the packet. The application can signal back to SAL if the packet has been consumed or no. In case of packet consumed SAL will prevent to keep passing to subsequent listener in the serial chain, but for handlers without dependency things will keep going . The packet will received will have the IncomingNodeConnector set to understand where the packet is coming from
        Specified by:
        receiveDataPacket in interface IListenDataPacket
        Parameters:
        inPkt - Packet received
        Returns:
        An indication if the packet should still be processed or we should stop it.
